message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the seasons and geographical locations. When flying from Europe to Australia in December, you are traveling from the Northern Hemisphere (where Europe is located) to the Southern Hemisphere (where Australia is located). In December, the Northern Hemisphere experiences winter, while the Southern Hemisphere experiences summer. Therefore, when you arrive in Australia, it will most likely be warm, and you will want to wear shorts. Options (A) and (B) are incorrect because they are clothing items associated with cold weather. Option (D) is incorrect because a ski mask is used for cold weather conditions, which would not be the case in Australia in December.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the weather and climate in different parts of the world. Australia is located in the Southern Hemisphere, which means that December is during their summer season. Therefore, when you arrive in Australia in December, you will most likely want to wear shorts because it will be warm and sunny. Option (A) is incorrect because a heavy coat is not necessary in a warm climate. Option (B) is not necessary because mittens are used to keep hands warm, which is not a concern in a warm climate. Option (D) is not necessary because a ski mask is used for cold weather activities such as skiing, which are not relevant in a warm climate.
